statement.tex: \text{To raise money for an orphanage. students} \\ \text{of three schools A, B and C organised an} \\ \text{exhibition in their locality, where they sold} \\ \text{paper bags, scrap-books and pastel sheets} \\ \text{made by them using recycled paper, at the} \\ \text{rate of ₹ 20, ₹ 15 and ₹ 5 per unit } \\ \text{respectively. School A sold 25 paper bags,} \\ \text{12 scrap-books and 34 pastel sheets. School B} \\ \text{sold 22 paper bags, 15 scrap-books and 28} \\ \text{pastel sheets while School C sold 26 paper bags} \\ \text{18 scrap-books and 36 pastel sheets. Using} \\ \text{matrices, find the total amount raised by each} \\ \text{school.} \\ \text{What values does such an exhibition inculcate} \\ \text{in the students?}

step.reason: \text{A $3\times 3$ matrix can only be } \\ \text{multiplied with a $3\times n$ matrix.}

step.context: \text{What is the product of these two matrices?} \\ \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 25 & 12 & 34 \\ 22 & 15 & 28 \\ 26 & 18 & 36 \end{array}\right]\times \left[\begin{array}{c} 20 \\ 15 \\ 5 \end{array}\right]
